You are given an array of $n$ integers, $A = [A_1, A_2, ..., A_n]$, and a positive integer $k$.  You can rearrange the elements of the array.  Find the minimum possible sum of the absolute differences between each element and its $k$th neighbor. 

For example, if $A = [1, 2, 4]$ and $k=2$, the sum of absolute differences would be $|1-2| + |2-4| + |4-1| = 1 + 2 + 3 = 6$.
